definition: to court disaster (idiom)/to dig one's own grave
self/oneself/from/since/naturally/surely
to take/to get/to choose/to fetch
to extinguish or put out/to go out (of a fire etc)/to exterminate or wipe out/to drown
old variant of 亡[wang2]
to die/to lose/to be gone/to flee/deceased

sentences.english: This poor woman will go to her grave without ever achieving her goal.
sentences.chinese: 这个可怜的女人实现不了她的目标，她会自取灭亡。

sentences.english: Experience has taught us that to adopt an ostrich-like policy here is suicidal.
sentences.chinese: 经验告诉我们对现实采取回避态度是自取灭亡。

sentences.english: Self barricading is to court one's own ruin.
sentences.chinese: 自我阻塞就是自取灭亡。

sentences.english: The church at Corinth was self-destructing because it was filled with division.
sentences.chinese: 哥林多教会因为充满分争而自取灭亡。

sentences.english: Procrastination, however, is the number one killer. Procrastinators self-destruct.
Niall Ferguson: "We've discussed two reasons to non-suicidal."
sentences.chinese: 我们已经讨论过两个不自取灭亡的理由。

to play with fire and get burnt (idiom); fig. to play with evil and suffer the consequences/to get one's fingers burnt
to ask for trouble (idiom)/to make a rod for one's own back
impossibly stupid
to burn both jade and common stone/to destroy indiscriminately (idiom)

to overestimate one's capabilities (idiom)
to go against the tide (idiom); to do things all wrong/to try to turn back history/a perverse way of doing things
to spin a cocoon around oneself (idiom); enmeshed in a trap of one's own devising/hoist by his own petard
lit. to eat one's own bitter fruit (idiom)/fig. to suffer the consequences of one's own actions/to stew in one's own juice
to overestimate one's capabilities
